Danganronpa: Prospective Despair
The Airship, Section B (KG) / cockpit
Kojima Akihiro | Mass 19-May-21 10:22 AM
The very forefront of the airship, the chamber that houses the controls that harnesses the craft itself. In comparison to most aircrafts, the cockpit installed onto the airship is rather spacious, the platform just behind the central area itself capable of holding up to at least 8 to 10 people. Just beside the door was a conspicuous lever secured in a semi-transparent material, the label beneath it written in bold, 'DANGER'. Interesting. In place of segmented windows, the walls are outfitted with multiple screens spanning almost the entire cockpit. The monitors display its own share of the outside view, captured in high resolution from the small cameras they're paired with on the outside half of the cockpit. The devices there are turned off whenever not in use, though the controls for doing so aren't accessible in the cockpit itself, for some odd reason. Once powered down or if the sensors detect the room has poor lighting, lights from above will automatically illuminate the room to compensate. There are two control panels on each side of the room, both serving different purposes that ensure the flight operations are executed smoothly. A set of staircases are established on each side, leading up to the aforementioned platform and lastly, there is the main, central control panel itself. Strewn with buttons, levers and switches with two control wheels for manual steering, this is where some of the more direct and upfront controls for the airship are located. While most of the buttons are readily available to be used by the pilot, some portions are sealed off tightly. Interestingly enough, one of said portions is currently toggled and lighting up in a dim green light. (edited)
